formalText: Helped patient fill out an IRS letter for his lawyer

Plan to update his file a little bit and soften some wording about how hard a time he is having, but still say he not out of the woods. Essentially will write he is a better functioning and more able to work with suicide and the depression.
Will need to take the time to write a letter by Friday when we meet
Came in feeling tired.
Because of a messed up sleep schedule, their meds are "so screwed up right now".
He started to up his dosage of Prozac
But he has run out and can't renew until tomorrow.
He still hasn't gotten any new Klonopin and he refuses to call for a new prescription.
He is anxious about work commitments but says,
"I guess I've been anxious over it for so long that I finally just gotten used to it."
He is concerned about how his work is going to reflect on him.
He tends to feel pretty responsible for things and feel like he messed up so many things that whenever there's a problem somebody's reasonably going to blame him.
He says he is okay without Klonopin because he has not had a whole lot to be really anxious over.
He talked about a litigation case he is working on  that's supposed to go on trial in January, which looks likely
He says, "My guy is screwed because there's nothing I can do for him
we can't go to trial in January because I'm completely unprepared"
He is tired of all the pills he has to take including the blood pressure medication.
He wants to spend his money on sports games, "If I don't go to the games, I'll be depressed but spending the money on the games makes me depressed.
He got caught up on his student loans.
He took his blood pressure and it was high.
because he is off the blood pressure medication
and doesn't want to go back on it.
